comment.author: 8623220@N02
comment._content: See also, 3 recently identified glass negatives of the 2nd inauguration: Soldiers and crowd, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cwpb.01430 Soldiers lining up, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cwpb.00601 Soldiers lined up, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/cwpb.00601 (Full story, Rediscovering Lincoln, www.loc.gov/loc/lcib/0803/lincoln.html )

comment.author: 69005233@N00
comment._content:
I did a montage "mashup" a few months ago after I returned from a trip to DC.  The base photo is from the LOC (although not yet here in The Commons) and is of the crowd at Lincoln's Second Inauguration:

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/curiouskiwi/2615762036/]

comment.author: 35330657@N04
comment._content: There is a story, that I have seen in a number of places that says that when Lincoln approached the podium to deliver the address, a shaft of light  broke through the clouds illuminating the Capitol step[s like a divine spotlight.

comment._content: Amazing to see considering the year wonderful quality.
